meanings.def: a person who is an expert in a particular area of work or study
examples: specialist in something a specialist in Japanese history
a communications/public relations/management specialist
specialist on something This is the view of virtually all independent specialists on the region.
She is a specialist in children's literature.
She is a specialist in eighteenth-century English painting.
The book is written by a noted specialist in the field.
They brought in an outside specialist to install the computer system.
a new generation of computer security specialists
a rural-development specialist
a specialist on the history of this city
A team of legal specialists were employed to work on the case.
He's a noted specialist in his field.

meanings.def: a doctor who has specialized in a particular area of medicine
examples: You need to see a specialist.
a cancer/fertility specialist
an eye/ear, nose, and throat specialist
I trained as a psychiatric specialist at the hospital.
a leading cancer specialist
I was sent to see a specialist at the local hospital.
Specialists believe that this condition is genetic.
an ear/​eye/​heart specialist

meanings.def: having or involving expert knowledge of a particular area of work, study or medicine
examples: specialist knowledge/training/skills
The patient should be transferred to a specialist unit.
We don't need any specialist equipment.
a specialist registrar/nurse/doctor
You need some specialist advice.
Her specialist subject is Italian Renaissance painting.
specialist care/​help
a specialist consultant in cancer genetics
specialist shops/​retailers
specialist journals/​magazines
